seriesJson.title: Voices of Europe
seriesJson.description: Interviews with noted Europeans on a variety of subjects, conducted by Milton Mayer, American author and broadcaster, lecturer and professor in the Institute of Social Research at Frankfurt University.

node.title: Elisabeth Noelle-Neumann
node.description: An interview about surveying public opinion with Dr. Elisabeth Noelle-Neumann, a German political scientist.

node.title: Andre and Magda Trocme
node.description: This program features an interview with Andre and Magda Trocme, a French couple who aided Jewish refugees during World War II.

node.title: Horstmar Stauber and Walter Wolman
node.description: This program features interviews with two German students about fraternities, societies, and student life.

node.title: Mario Tosoni, Silvio Leonardi, and Adriano Olivetti
node.description: In this program, Milton Mayer speaks to three Italians: a schoolteacher, and two businessman.

node.title: Andre Maurois and Gunnar Myrdal
node.description: This program features interviews with French author Andre Maurois and with Swedish sociologist and economist Gunnar Myrdal.

node.title: Bertrand Russell
node.description: This program features interviews with Bertrand Russell

node.title: Countess Maria Goedela von Bismarck-Sch̦nhausen
node.description: An interview with Countess Maria Goedela von Bismarck-Sch̦nhausen about the changes in Germany from the 19th century to the midpoint of the 20th century. Main topics include her grandfather, Otto von Bismarck, and her husband, Hermann Graf Keyserling.

node.title: Judaism after World War II
node.description: This program features an interview with a rabbi about Judaism in Germany in the aftermath of World War II.

node.title: Martin Niemo_ller and Karl Barth
node.description: This program features interviews with the German pastor and theologian Martin Niemo_ller and the Swiss theologian Karl Barth.

node.title: An Austrian on the United States
node.description: In this program, an Austrian woman reflects on her time spent living in the United States.

node.title: Salvador de Madariaga and William Allen Jowitt
node.description: This program features interviews with the Spanish writer Salvador de Madariaga and with British politician and lawyer William Allen Jowitt.

node.title: Meteorology and the Swiss film industry
node.description: This program consists of two separate interviews. In the first interview, Milton Mayer interviews an Austrian doctor and professor of meteorology. In the second interview, Mayer speaks to Lazar Wechsler, a Swiss film producer.

node.title: G.D.H. Cole
node.description: This program presents an interview with G.D.H. Cole about socialism in Great Britain.

node.title: Claude Bourdet
node.description: This program presents an interview with Claude Bourdet, a French writer and journalist who was active in the French Resistance during World War II.

node.title: Oswald Mosley
node.description: This program features an interview with British fascist leader, Oswald Mosley.

node.title: Walter Gaupp
node.description: This program features an interview with Walter Gaupp, a German headmaster of a school that was part of the Experiment in International Living.

node.title: Erich Hoffmann
node.description: This program features interviews with Erich Hoffmann and Hans-Peter Muller about student exchange programs and work camps.

node.title: Baron Von Munchausen
node.description: This program features an interview with the grandson of Baron Von Munchausen.

subject.name: Mu_nchhausen, Karl Friedrich Hieronymus von, Baron, 1720-1797

node.title: Elisabeth Mann-Borgese and Kurt Rieder
node.description: This program features interviews with Elisabeth Mann-Borgese and Kurt Rieder about, respectively, education in Europe and conditions in South Tyrol.

node.title: Gottlieb Duttweiler and Enriques Agnoletti
node.description: This program features interviews with Gottlieb Duttweiler, a Swiss businessman, and Enriques Agnoletti, a politician and member of the Italian Resistance.

node.title: Black market
node.description: This program addresses "what makes the black market black" and looks at the thriving black market in Europe.

node.title: Hallam Tennyson and voices on the street.
node.description: This program features an interview with Hallam Tennyson, the great-grandson of Alfred Lord Tennyson. The second part of the program features interviews with various people in Hyde Park about the state of England at the time.

node.title: Erik von Kuehnelt-Leddihn
node.description: This program features an interview with Erik von Kuehnelt-Leddihn, an Austrian nobleman and socio-political theorist.

node.title: Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker
node.description: This program features an interview with the German physicist and philosopher Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker.

subject.name: Weizsa_cker, Carl Friedrich, Freiherr von, 1912-2007--Political and social views.

node.title: Herr Ernst-Heinrich Schaefer and M. Chazelle
node.description: Interviews with Ernst-Heinrich Schaefer, a Saarlander in the steel industry, and Jacques Chazelle, a French diplomat. Current issues in Saarland are discussed.

node.title: Hermann Trittlewitz and Dr. Edith Pulewka
node.description: Interviews with Hermann Trittlewitz and Dr. Edith Pulewka, with a focus on the Saarland region in Germany.

node.title: Abstract art
node.description: This program features a joint interview with abstract painters Edgard Pillet and Rella Rudolph on abstract art.

node.title: Klause Kammler and Huguette Kailat
node.description: This program features interviews with two European students, one from Germany and another from France.

node.title: Dr. Herbert Tingsten and Claude Petit
node.description: Interviews with Dr. Herbert Tingsten and Claude Petit about, respectively, life in Sweden and France.

node.title: Elsa Adami and Nina Oulasevitch
node.description: Interviews with Elsa Adami and Nina Oulasevitch about traveling through Europe and lodging for travelers.

node.title: Dr. Gerrit Jan van Heuven Goedhart
node.description: An interview Dr. Gerrit Jan van Heuven Goedhart, a Dutch politician and diplomat.

node.title: Mademoiselle Hedy and Maire Halonen
node.description: Interviews with a Mademoiselle Hedy and Maire Halonen about, respectively, existentialist living in Paris and life in Finland during World War II.

node.title: Sven Lindquist
node.description: An interview with Sven Lindquist, a Swedish man who is intently focused on world affairs. The main topic is the current state of Sweden, as well as the impact that World War II had on Sweden.

node.title: F.K. Otto Dibelius and Martin Stiencke
node.description: Interviews with F.K. Otto Dibelius and Martin Stiencke about Christianity and Buddhism in Germany.

node.title: Johan Hannak and Dr. Kurt Rothschild
node.description: Interviews with Johan Hannak and Dr. Kurt Rothschild, two Austrians, about issues in Austria in the aftermath of World War II.

node.title: Olavi Aarnio and Dr. Olli Vaartaja
node.description: Interviews with Olavi Aarnio and Dr. Olli Vaartaja about issues in Finland, particularly during World War II.

node.title: The population problem
node.description: Interviews with Dr. McCormick and Dr. Karl Evang on the population problem.

node.title: A. S. Neill, Paul Geheeb and Dr. Teresita Sandesky Scelba
node.description: Interviews with A. S. Neill, Paul Geheeb and Dr. Teresita Sandesky Scelba about education in Europe.

node.title: The Duke of Bedford and Lord Adams
node.description: Interviews with The Duke of Bedford and Lord Adams.

node.title: W. Grigor McClelland
node.description: An interview with W. Grigor McClelland, a British businessman who toured Communist China and the Soviet Union to assess life and business under communism for himself.

node.title: Gertrud Muller
node.description: An interview with Gertrud Muller, a young German woman from a small town, about a U.S. $50 bill that she had come into possession of, which was then against the law in Germany. Some of her opinions reflect the antisemitism that persisted in Germany after World War II.

node.title: Ade_le Heilborn and Agda Rossel
node.description: Interviews with Ade_le Heilborn and Agda Rossel. Topics covered relate to Sweden.

node.title: Emil Frederiksen and Knud Klem
node.description: Interviews with  Emil Frederickson and Knud Klem that discuss elements of Danish culture.

node.title: Percy Diggle and Joseph Keiling.
node.description: Interviews with Percy Diggle and Joe Keiling about issues related to England.

node.title: Nona Suminah Kamil and Dr. P. J. Koets
node.description: Interviews with Nona Suminah Kamil and Dr. P. J. Koets about Indonesia and its then-recent independence.

node.title: John Strachey and Paolo Vittorelli
node.description: Interviews with the British Labour politician John Strachey and the Italian socialist politician, Paolo Vittorelli.

node.title: Professor Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker and Pastor Wilhelm Meusching
node.description: Interviews with physicist Professor Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker and Pastor Wilhelm Meusching.

node.title: Headley Whitehead
node.description: Milton Mayer interviews Headley Whitehead, British warden of a residential youth center in Manchester. They discuss the co-operative movement in Britain.

node.title: Dr. John Rawlings Rees and Dr. Hans Hoff
node.description: Interviews with Dr. John Rawlings Rees and Dr. Hans Hoff about psychology and the mental well-being of Europeans in the mid-20th century.

node.title: Dr. Alf Ahlberg and Gertrud Magaziner
node.description: Interviews with Dr. Alf Ahlberg and Gertrud Magaziner about education in Sweden and Austria.

node.title: Reverend Michael Scott
node.description: An interview with Reverend Michael Scott, focused on issues in South Africa.

node.title: Max Habicht
node.description: An interview with Max Habicht.

node.title: Renato Mieli
node.description: An interview with Renato Mieli, an Italian communist leader.

node.title: Five European students
node.description: This program presents an interview with five European students about culture and world politics in the early 1950s.

node.title: Dr. Schmidt and Hilda Pabst
node.description: Interviews with "Dr. Schmidt" about German prisoners of war and Hilda Pabst about young people's attitudes on Germany and remilitarization.

node.title: Hannelore Altmeier and Fritz Schneider
node.description: Interviews with Hannelore Altmeier and Fritz Schneider, two young Germans. The primary topic is life in East Germany and how it relates to West Germany.

node.title: Yvonne Brunoy and Maria Comberti
node.description: Interviews with Yvonne Brunoy, a Parisian prostitute and Maria Comberti, an Italian villa owner.

node.title: Lord Beveridge
node.description: An interview with Lord Beveridge about his highly influential "Beveridge Report."

node.title: Dr. Mogens Fog and Gerald Bailey
node.description: Interviews with Dr. Mogens Fog, a Danish communist leader, and Gerald Bailey, a British Quaker activist.

node.title: Hans Neumann and Frau Wagner
node.description: Interviews with Hans Neumann and "Frau Wagner" about life in West Berlin and East Berlin in the years after World War Two.

node.title: The Carmen story
node.description: An interview with Carmen Ruiz de Garibay, a Spanish noblewoman living in France.

node.title: Odd Nansen and Waltraud Skupin
node.description: Interviews with Odd Nansen and Waltraud Skupin. Topics include Germany, Silesia, and humanitarianism.

node.title: Helmut Weber
node.description: An interview with Helmut Weber, a Neo-Nazi leader in Germany.

node.title: Professor Carl Hermann and Eva Hermann
node.description: An interview with Professor Carl Hermann and Eva Hermann about life in Germany under the Nazis.

node.title: Pastor Martin Niemo_ller
node.description: An interview with Pastor Martin Niemo_ller, a German clergyman who was imprisoned by the Nazis during World War II.

node.title: Saarland
node.description: An interview with an anonymous Saarlander, referred to as "Herr Busch," about recent developments with Saarland and its independence.

node.title: "Prof. Schmidt" and "Frau Margarete Lehman"
node.description: Interviews with the pseudonymous  "Professor Schmidt" and Margarete Lehman, two Germans each from a different side of the divide in Germany.

node.title: Dr. Renate Unkrodt
node.description: An interview with Dr. Renate Unkrodt, a German journalist.

node.title: Lauri Posti and Irmeli Viherjuuri
node.description: Milton Mayer interviews Professor Lauri Posti and Irmeli Viherjuuri. Topics discussed include the Finnish language and the Finnish tradition of saunas.

node.title: Paul and Ingeborg Fent
node.description: An interview with Paul Fent, a Viennese playwright, and Ingeborg Fent, a fairy tale writer. The Fents talk about Austria, its history and culture.

node.title: Friedrich Luft and Wolfgang Staudte
node.description: Interviews with Friedrich Luft and Wolfgang Staudte. Both interviews discuss the states of theater and film in Germany in the years after World War Two.

node.title: Willy Kressman and Senator Bach
node.description: Interviews with Willy Kressman and Otto Bach, two German politicians.

node.title: Veli Merikoski and Dr. Arvo Puukari
node.description: Interviews with Professor Veli Merikoski and Dr. Arvo Puukari about Finland during World War II and its aftermath.

node.title: Dr. Carlo Levi and Dr. Riccardo Bauer
node.description: Interviews with Dr. Carlo Levi and Dr. Riccardo Bauer. Levi talks about Rome and Bauer talks about life in prison under the Italian fascists.

node.title: Josef L. Hromadka
node.description: An interview with Professor Josef L. Hromadka about conditions in Czechoslovakia.

node.title: Lucy Gable and Ines Zilli-Guy
node.description: Interviews with Lucy Gable and Ines Zilli-Guy about life for women in Europe.

node.title: Prince Valerio Borghese
node.description: An interview with Prince Valerio Borghese, an Italian fascist leader.

node.title: Kaspar Mayr and Major Jan Linzel
node.description: Interviews with Kaspar Mayr and Jan Linzel about pacifism.

node.title: Dr. Johannes Novrup and Peter Manniche
node.description: Interviews with Dr. Johannes Novrup and Peter Manniche about education in Denmark.

node.title: Robert Silvey and Robert Fabian
node.description: Interviews with Robert Silvey of the British Broadcasting Corporation and Superintendent Robert Fabian, a former detective at Scotland Yard.

node.title: Don Manetti and Giovanni Pioli
node.description: Interviews with Don Manetti and Professor Giovanni Pioli about Catholicism and fascism in Italy.

node.title: Ailo Maegaard and Sven Fisker
node.description: Interviews with Ailo Maegaard and Sven Fisker about the importance of shipping and agriculture to the Danish economy.

node.title: Dr. Willem Visser t'Hooft
node.description: An interview with Dr. Willem Visser t'Hooft about his work with the World Council of Churches.

subject.name: Christian Churches and Churches of Christ

node.title: Lionel Durand and Claude Terrail
node.description: Interviews with Lionel Durand and Claude Terrail. The interviews focus on issues in France and, particularly, Paris.

node.title: Sir Herbert Broadley and Dr. P. F. Noach
node.description: Interviews with Sir Herbert Broadley and Dr. P. F. Noach. Topics covered include United Nations efforts to combat hunger and poverty.

subject.name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

node.title: Paolo Sylos Labini and Veniero Marsan
node.description: Interviews with Paolo Sylos Labini and Veniero Marsan about economic conditions in Italy.
